Data.Title: Pronoum I: First person singular
Description: There are different types of pronouns depending on if we are man or woman and who are we talking to:
- Very formal Fem/Masc: わたくし　(Watakushi)
- Formal Masculine: 私　(わたし - Watashi)
- Formal Female: あたくし (atakushi)
- Casual Masculine: 僕　(ぼく - Boku)
- Casual Female: あたし (atashi)
- Very Casual Masculine: 俺　(おれ - Ore)

Sentence: - おれ　は　ちがう。。。
- こいつ　は　僕　が　殺す。。。
Kana: - おれ　は　ちがう...
- こいつ　は　ぼく　が　ころす。。。
Kanjis: - 僕 = I (male casual) (ぼく - Boku)|- 殺す = Kill (ころす - Korosu)
English: - I'm wrong... (A boy talking to himself)

Data.Title: Pronoum We: First person plural
Description: There are different types of pronouns depending on if we are man or woman and who are we talking to:
- Very formal Fem/Masc: わたくしども　(Watakushidomo)
- Formal Masc/Fem: わたくしたち　(Watakushitachi) or わたしたち (Watashitachi)
- Casual Masculine: ぼくたち (Bokutachi) or　ぼくら (Bokura)
- Casual Female: あたしたち (Atashitachi) or　あたしら (Atashira)
- Very Casual Masculine: おれたち　(Oretachi)

Sentence: - 私たち　わかれましょう
Kana: - わたしたち わかれましょう
Kanjis: - 私たち = We (わたしたち - Watashitachi)

Data.Title: Pronoum You: Second person singular
Description: There are different types of pronouns depending who are we talking to:
- Formal Masc/Fem: あにた　(Anita)
- Casual Masc/Fem: きみ (Kimi)
- Very Casual Masc/Fem: おまえ (omae) or　あんた (anta)
Sometimes instead of using the pronoum, the name of the person is used:
- 田中さん　は　頭　が　いい　です (Tanaka-san wa atama ga ii desu) = Tanaka is smart.

Data.Title: Pronoum You: Second person plural
Description: There are different types of pronouns depending who are we talking to:
- Formal Masc/Fem: あなたがた　(Anatagachi)
- Casual Masc: きみだち (kimitachi) or　きみら (Kimira)
- Casual Fem: あなたたち (Anatatachi)
- Very Casual Masc: おまえたち (Omaetachi) or　おまえら (Omaera)
- Very Casual Mas/Fem: あんたたち (Antatachi) or あんたら(Antara)

Data.Title: Pronoum She, He: Third person singular
Description: There are no word for She or He. In Japanese you use the nomber or title of the person who is refered to.
The sentences 'You are smart' and 'The teacher is smart' can be transalated the same way => 先生　は　あたま　が　いい　です。(Sensei ha atama ga ii desu)
The difference is that the first sentece we are talking to that person and the second one we are talking about him.
There are 2 words for the third person (they also mean girlfriend and boyfriend):
- 彼 = Him（かれ - Kare)
- 彼女 = Her（かのじょ - Kanojo

Sentence: 彼女 は　あたま　が　いい　です
Kana: かのじょ　は　あたま　が　いい　です
Kanjis: - 彼女 = Her（かのじょ - Kanojo
Romaji: Kanojo ga atama ga ii desu.
